RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: Committed to the social, environmental and economic health of our communities; Provide design resources, information, and volunteer services to community-based organizations, educational institutions, and government agencies. Promote equal access to sustainably-built environments for low- and moderate-income communities through public educational program and participatory design and planning processes.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The VP of Finance and Administration staff oversee that the provisions of the grant are met in accordance with the guidelines or agreement set forth, whether that's use of donor, government or private sources. In the case of the CDRC, annual financial reports are reviewed by a BAC Board member and the BAC president to determine proper use of funds granted under the agreement.

Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Trustees has directed the Audit Committee to review the Form 990 on its behalf and upon its satisfaction forward it for execution to the President. The fully executed Form 990 is sent to each member of the Board of Trustees prior to its submission to the Internal Revenue Service.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Covered Trustees, Overseers, Senior Staff members, members of standing governance committees, and volunteer and compensated faculty members must file a statement set forth in the Disclosure provisions of the Conflict of Interest Policy, disclosing his or her personal, business, and organizational interests and affiliations, including membership on boards of other not-for-profit institutions. Disclosure statements shall be filed annually with the Chair of the Board of Trustees and the President or their designees, and shall be updated whenever significant changes occur that may be affected by this Policy. The Chair of the Board of Trustees and the President will review the statements and contact the affected person if there appears to be a conflict of interest. A Trustee or Overseer shall not vote on, approve, or recommend approval of any transaction between the Boston Architectural College and that party or their family member as set forth above, and should disclose any potential conflict prior to a vote or other action. If such an affected party is present when a matter involving a potential conflict of interest is considered, that party shall leave the meeting during that discussion and/or the vote.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: For the president's salary, the benchmark would be the CUPA information on colleges and universities in New England of similar size. Those benchmarks greatly exceed what is affordable for the BAC, thus the salary is selected on performance and budgetary constraints taken into account. The Compensation Committee assigned by the Board of Trustees for the purpose of reviewing salary benchmarks of peer institutes, determined that the salaries of other officers and key employees were consistent with these benchmarks.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements are made available to the public upon request.
Part II, Line 5a, Proceeds: Proceeds used for credit enhancement = $814,146 Proceeds used for bond issuance costs = $258,000
